english: When I say we'll back off.

text: Biz de hepsini tek tek avlayacağız.
english: We'll hunt them all down one by one.
...and we'll fall on them like lightning.
I brought you what you wanted, and I took my son back.
I will not submit to your stubbornness.
I will not yield to your stubbornness!

text: Diliniz bu kadar konuşacağına kılıcınız konuşsa, bizim gibi cihanı keserdiniz.
english: If your sword spoke rather than your tongue, you would cut off the engine like us.
Kill the mother and her son!
Come on, my boy, come on, my boy!

text: Hasmın ne kadar güçlüyse, zaferin o kadar büyük olur.
english: The stronger your enemy, the greater your victory.

text: Bugüne dek öldürdüğüm en güçlü düşman olacaksın.
english: You'll be the most powerful enemy I've ever killed.

text: Ayakta ölmeyi hak edecek kadar yiğit bir düşman değilsin.
english: You're not a brave enemy to die on your feet.
Besides, we're gonna have to go to the heads...

text: Ölümü en çok istediğin vakitte seni öldürmedim.
english: I didn't kill you when you wanted to die the most.

text: Şimdi yaşamak istediğin vakit, ölümü tat.
english: Now that you want to live, taste death.

text: ...adamlarımız Turgutların peşinden gitti lakin daha dönmediler.
english: ...our men went after the Turgut but they haven't returned.

text: Bir de biz gidip bakalım mı?
english: So we should go and see?

text: O kadar adamı da haklayamayacaklarsa geberip gitsinler.
english: If they can't get enough of that, they'll die.
We need the head of Ertuğrul and Alıncak.
I'm going to finish it this time, Ertuğrul!
I took the veil off your face.
I'm gonna take your neck down now, you son of a bitch.
We're at the end of the road.
It's not us anymore, it's our swords that will speak.
Death is not so easy for you.

text: Her mazlum için bin defa öleceksin.
english: You'll die a thousand times for every poor man.

text: Ayağımın altına aldığım ilk düşman değilsin.
english: You're not the first enemy I've ever set foot in.

text: Senin de kaderin diğerleri gibi ezilmek olacak.
english: You'll be crushed like the rest of them.
Take this clan to the Sughut.
We'll find out what you're up to with the cloud.
I'm fine, sir, with God's help.

Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey!
Sir, I'm a prisoner of you.

text: Bu yaptığının nelere mâl olduğunu bilir misin Bamsı?
english: Do you know what it's worth, Bams?

text: Sen ne ara aklını bu kadar yitirdin?
english: When did you lose your mind so much?
Sir, the Albany is not dead.
But I did it for my son.
...it's not a shame to cut my hair.

text: Bana vereceğin her türlü cezaya razıyım beyim.
english: I'm willing to accept any punishment you may impose on me, sir.

text: Turgut'la Alpler, Albastı'yı kıstırmak için pusuya gittiler.
english: Turgut and the Alps ambushed Albasty.

text: Senin bu yaptığın yüzünden geç kaldık.
english: We're late for what you did.

text: Dua et ki başlarına bir hâl gelmesin Bamsı.
english: Pray that nothing will happen to them, Bamshi.

text: Ben de geleyim. Mademki Turgut gardaşımın canı mevzubahis...
english: I'll come, since my brother Turgut's life is in dispute...
I'll come and fight you, sir.

text: Sen daha benim yanımda vuruşmayı hak etmedin.
english: You don't deserve to fight with me yet.
I'll see you when I get back.
Let's not leave a trail behind.

text: Tez hareket edelim. Turgut'a yetişeceğiz. Hadi, hadi, hadi!
english: We'll move fast, we'll reach Turgut.
They haven't brought the Ally yet.
Dragos, has he surrendered the Pursuit?

text: (Erkek) Tam Bamsı'yla oğlunu öldürecekken Ertuğrul geldi.
english: (Man) When Tam Bamshi and his son were about to kill, Ertuğrul came.
(Man) The Purple was killed by Ertuğrul.

text: (Erkek) Ben de onu görünce hemen geldim beyim.
english: (Man) I saw him and I came right back, man.

text: -O da öldü mü? -(Erkek) Ben buraya gelirken...

english: I don't know what happened now, sir.

text: O Dragos keferesi ne yapıp edip, yakayı kurtaracaktır.
english: What the Dragos's gonna do is save the side.

text: Lakin yakalanırsa bizim için iyi olmaz.
english: But it's not good for us if he gets caught.

text: Gayrı bundan sonrası haybeye vuruşma olur beyim.
english: It's not a fight from now on, sir.
There's no point in waiting here.
Let's go to the mansion, come on.
We've done the work of those who came after us.
Now we're going to go over the dog in the sky.
You take care of our wounded partner.
Branas, it was a big disaster.

text: Dragos, Alıncak'ı alırken Ertuğrul, Alpleriyle gelmiş.
english: Dragos came with the Alps when he took the Pursuit.
We have a wounded soldier reporting.
Captain Dragos has taken him to the Alpine Command.

text: Komutan Dragos sağ olarak Söğüt'e götürülecekse...
english: If Commander Dragos is to be taken to the Cave alive...
We'll play the Sound tonight if we have to.
He's always careful, if he gets killed...

text: ...ya da yakalanırsa ne yapmamız gerektiğini yazdı.
english: ...or what we should do if caught.

text: Söğüt için son büyük savaş vakti gelmiştir.
english: The time has come for the last great war for the troops.
We're not alone in this war.
The cloud will be with us.
How can we trust him, Branas?
What if he turns his back on us?
Then I'm not saying that Albasty is dead...
...first Ertuğrul will know who Beybolât is.

text: Bizimle sonuna kadar savaşmak zorunda kalacak.
english: He's gonna have to fight us to the end.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Komutan Dragos için sonuna kadar savaş!
english: Fight to the end for Commander Dragos!

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Komutan Dragos için ölümüne kadar savaş!
english: Fight to the death for Commander Dragos!
My Lord Turgut, they all escaped.
They were too crowded to escape.

text: Albastı, Alıncak'ı almadan bir yere gitmez.
english: The blonde doesn't go anywhere without taking the Purple.

text: Bu işin içinde bir iş var. Alpler...

english: ...we will be patient and wait for Mr. Ertuğrul here.
They came to make a fuss, we fought.

text: Lakin çok kalabalık olmalarına rağmen kaçtılar.
english: But they fled, despite the crowd.
He wouldn't leave without taking the Purple.

text: Gittiğine göre Alıncak’ın öldüğünü öğrenmiş demektir.
english: He's gone, so he found out the Purple Man was dead.

text: Bamsı büyük bir hata etti Turgut.
english: The old lady made a big mistake, Turgut.

text: Oğlunu kurtarmak için Alıncak'ı Dragos'a götürmeye kalktı.
english: He tried to take the Pony to Dragos to save his son.
He was trying to save Aybars.
But he fell into Dragos' trap.
I finished the work of the Plumber.

text: Alıncak, Dragos'un ne işine yarayacak beyim?
english: What's the use of Dragos, my lord?
...who wanted to buy it for his vest.

text: Albastı iti de burada onu bekledi.
english: And the dog on the couch was waiting for him here.

text: Ya Albastı? O, Beybolat mıdır beyim?
Emin olmak için son bir adım kaldı.
english: One last step to make sure.
Wait nicely before you make a sound!

text: Son savaşımı verene kadar da bitmeyecek.
english: It won't be over until I give my last fight.

text: Fare gibi deliğe tıkıldın sonunda Dragos.
english: You're stuck in a hole like a mouse, Dragos.
...and I'm gonna punch your chest and come out...
I'll take it out of here, Malik Shah.

text: Bu kez başının üstünde Ertuğrul Bey’imin kılıcı vardır.
english: This time, he has the sword of Ertuğrul Beyzim over his head.

text: Hükmetmeyi hayal ettiğin Söğüt’ün ortasına çıkarıp...
english: You're gonna take the government out into the middle of the jungle you dream of...

text: ...seni ahaliye rezil rüsva ederek indirecek kılıcını başına.
english: ...to bring shame upon you and bring shame upon your people.

text: Komutan Dragos ha? Güya Söğüt’e hâkim olacak...
english: Captain Dragos, it seems that the Commander will rule...
...the Dragos who will wipe out the Turks.

text: Biz senin gibi çok komutanı ezip geçtik.
english: We've been through many commanders like you.

text: Senin de o rezil başını gövdenden koparacağız Dragos...
english: We're gonna rip that disgraceful head off your body, Dragos...

text: Son nefesimi verene kadar da beni yenemeyeceksiniz.
english: You won't defeat me until I take my last breath.
You'll see who Commander Dragos is.
Ana, these are my dad and Aybars.
My God, my God, thank you.

text: Aybars'tır bu anam. Yanında da Bamsı vardır.
english: This is Aybars, my mother, and she's got Bamshi.
My baby, my baby, my lamb!
- You're a piece of shit in my eye, baby.

text: (Hafsa) Seni veren Allah'a kurban olurum ben.
english: (Please) I will sacrifice myself to the God who gave you.

text: Gözümde tüttün, iyi ki buradasın yavrum.
english: You're in my eye, I'm glad you're here, baby.

text: Başınıza bir hâl gelecek diye çok korktuk babam.
english: We were so afraid that something would happen to you, Dad.

text: Geçti kuzum, geçti. Bak, geldi kardeşin.
english: It's gone, it's gone, it's your brother.

text: Anam, çok özledim seni. Burnumda tüttün.
english: Mom, I missed you so much.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'imle babam sayesinde Hayme Ana.
english: Thanks to my father and my Master Ertuğrul.

text: -Gözün aydın olsun Hafsa bacım. -Sağ olasın Selcan Hatun.
english: - Keep your eyes open, Hafsa sister.
My grandmother, the bright son of the eye.

text: Bamsı, oğlun kurtuldu lakin suratın asık.
english: Your son is alive, but your face is hanging.
But I made a big mistake.
I'm going to save my Aybars...
I didn't listen to my Lord Ertugrul.
I made a big mistake, Mom.
...but he'll know when my red sword lands on him.

text: Beyim, Turgut’un üstüne gönderdiğimiz adamlarımızın birçoğu ölmüş.
english: Sir, many of the men we sent over Turgut are dead.

text: Bir de yaralımız var. Obaya getirirler.
english: We also have wounds, they're bringing them to the hospital.
They didn't come for a Turgut.
If he was caught, he'd know.
We gave him the son of Bamsy...

text: Gayrı şimdi Ertuğrul’dan intikam almak için çırpınacaktır.
english: Now the Gairi will be clamoring for revenge on Ertuğrul.

text: Dragos'la görüşmemiz icap eder. Haber gönderesin Baturalp.
english: It's a good idea to meet Dragos.
- Do you have a record, sir?

text: Beyim, Söğüt’ten haber geldi. Ertuğrul Bey sizi çağırırmış.
english: Sir, the Commander has called you.
When you say we're out of the loop...
...and now Dragos has been taken over by Ertuğrul.
...this land will be a battlefield for us.

text: İş birliği bir tarafa beyim, senin Albastı olduğunu öterse...
english: If the co-op side says you're Albany...

text: Albastı’yı öldürdüm, Ertuğrul da gözleriyle gördü.
english: I killed the cloud, and Ertuğrul saw it with his own eyes.

text: Lakin yine de Dragos'un ötmemesi icap eder.
english: But it's still a good idea for Dragos not to sing.
All the accounts are in sync, Baturalp.
Or this blinded one will drown us...

text: ...ya da biz o kördüğümü kökünden kesip atacağız.
english: ...or we'll cut that blind one out of the way.

text: ...herkesten dinlediğim lakin doya doya göremediğim anam.
english: ...my mother, who I listened to from everyone but couldn't get enough of.
I'd believe you said that if I didn't know you.

text: Lakin ele avuca sığmayan bey oğlu Osman...
english: But Osman, the son of the man who didn't fit in the palm of his hand...

text: ...burada böyle bir başına oturuyorsa, elbet bir derdi vardır.
english: ...if he's sitting here alone like this, there's got to be a problem.
(Seljan) Osman with black eyebrows, black eyes.
You're gonna hide your pain from the victor?

text: Bir derdin var da bunu bana demeye imtina mı edersin?
english: You have a problem and you won't tell me?

text: -Yengeni ırak mı belleyesin? -Yok. O nasıl kelamdır!
english: - You want to call it a new river?

text: Her derdimize ortak olan sen ıraksan...
english: If you're the one who's been in our trouble...
...the smoke from the top of the scattered, come on.
He protects her, he holds her...

text: Ana deyince yüreğimde bir sızı, gözümde yaş, yüreğime bir acı gelir.
english: When I say mother, I have a cry in my heart, tears in my eyes, pain in my heart.

text: Benim anam da Hafsa Hatun gibi fedakâr...
english: My mother was a victim like Hafsa Hatun...
All mothers are like that, Osman.
Do you know what you're saying, Ma?

text: Evladının başına kar yağsa, ananın yüreği donar.
english: If it snows on your son, a mother's heart freezes.
If the sunlight touches your son's skin...

text: Biri dönüp ana diye seslendiği vakit...
english: When someone turns and calls me mother...
...and a painful companion sits in my heart...

text: Kendimi akça ırmaklara dahi atsam, geçmez.
english: Even if I'm on the white river, it won't pass.

text: Bir derdin var mıdır diye sormuştun ya...
english: You asked if you had a problem.
I'm going to miss my mother.

text: Silinmeyen tek yazı, alına yazılandır Osman.
english: The only unerasable font, type it in front of Osman.

text: Sen ana diye yanarsın, ben de evlat diye.
english: You're burning for a mother, I'm burning for a son.

text: Bilirim, istesem de ananın yerini tutamam...
english: I know, but I can't take your place if I want to.
I can't hold you like that.
But with the longing for a son in my heart...

text: ...ben de seni evladım gibi bağrıma basarım.
english: I'll scream at you like my son.

text: Hakkın ödenmez yenge. Biz de seni ana belleriz.
english: Your right is unpaid, cousin, and we'll make you a mother.

text: Dragos'un dirisi, ölüsünden daha çok işimize yarayacaktır.
english: Dragos's life will do us more good than his death.
And the people in the fort to save him...

text: Beybolat Bey'i de bu sebeple mi çağırdın beyim?
english: Is that why you called Beybolat, sir?

text: Eğer Beybolat Bey tahmin ettiğimiz gibi Albastı'ysa...
english: If Beybolat is Albany, as we suspected...

text: O vakit kaledekilerle birlikte kılıcını bize doğrultacaktır.
english: Then he will draw his sword to us with those in the fortress.

text: Bu da onun Albastı olduğunu ayan beyan ispat edecektir.
english: Which will prove that he's a Cloud.

text: Yarın Söğüt'te buna göre tertibat alacağız Abdurrahman.
english: We'll arrange for that tomorrow at the Somat, Abdurrahman.
...and we will finish the Fortress of Love.

text: Onları buraya çekmekten gayemiz, yalnızca Dragos ve Albastı için...
english: We're not gonna drag them here, just for Dragos and Albasty...

text: Asıl gayemiz, boşalttıkları kaleyi zapt etmektir.
english: Our main objective is to capture the castle they've evacuated.
It won't be harvested until the root is dried.

text: Yarın Söğüt düşmanlarımıza mezar olacak Turgut Bey.
english: Tomorrow the Sogyad will be the grave of our enemies, Mr. Turgut.
And the irony in the Castle of Lefke...
...and we will pour out the fitna within us.
Sir, Beybolat has entered the Bey Sughut.
Let him come, let him come...

text: ...evvela avımı ayağıma getiren alıcı kuşum olsun...
english: ...and I'll have a bird of prey to hunt me first...

text: Ertuğrul Bey'im sizi bekler Beybolat Bey.
english: My lord Ertuğrul is waiting for you, Beybolat.
Let's not keep our three-man waiting, shall we?
To expose Beybolát to the public...

text: Zira Beybolat'ın Albastı olduğunu ifşa etmeden ipini çekersek...
english: Because if we pull the rope without revealing Beybolat's being a Nebast...
...and there's a blood fight with Umuroglu House...
...and there would be discomfort with the Turkish villages.
...not even her sisters know about it.
Because if they knew he was Albany...
...the whole village turned away from him.

text: Söğüt'te kellesini aldığın komutan değildi madem...
english: He wasn't the commander you cut off at the front.

text: Dragos, zangocun ta kendisidir Beybolat Bey.
english: Dragos is the one who is the bellhop, Beybolat.

text: Kendine bile hayrı olmayan o kambur sefil...
english: That little bastard who's not even good for himself...
How could he be so cunning?

text: O ne kamburdur ne de sefil.
english: He is neither a fool nor a fool.

text: Gördüğün vakit sen de anlayacaksın Beybolat Bey.
english: You'll know when you see it, Beybolat.
...please, I'm not gonna put my father's blood on the ground.

text: O soysuz yarın zulmettiği ahalinin önünde infaz edilecek.
english: He will be executed tomorrow in front of his persecuted family.
I'm gonna learn some important things from him.
He'll tell me who he's working with.
You need to know all the secrets first.

text: Kim bilir onun gibi bir adamın içinde neler vardır?
english: Who knows what's in a man like that?
But first, you go and talk.

text: Başını kesemesen de suratına tükürmek hakkındır.
english: You have the right to spit in your face even if you can't cut off your head.
...may Beybolat face the killer of his father.
I saw in your eyes that Bebolat was stretched like a bow.

text: İmdi Dragos’la konuşunca ok gibi üzerimize fırlayacaktır.
english: Now, when he talks to Dragos, he'll shoot at us like an arrow.

text: Beybolat Bey de farkında olmadan zaferimiz için canla...
english: Beybolat, unwittingly, lives for our victory...
He'll get his reward in excess.
Sister, you can't understand the patterns if you do that.
- You're the father of weddings more often.

text: Alpler söyledi. Ertuğrul Bey, Dragos'u yakalamış.
english: The Alps said, Ertigrul, the master, has captured Dragos.
And you know who he is?

text: (Geçiş sesi) Sen burada olup biten her şeyden...
english: (Laughter) You know, from everything that's been going on here...
You said I'd get it, right?
But I don't see it, I carry it on my back.
If you give me the information I need...
...I'll lighten the pain in your throat.

text: Size işinize yarayacak bilgileri vermeye devam edeceğim.
english: I'll keep giving you the information you need.

text: Nasıl kimse anlayamadı onun gerçek yüzünü?
english: How come no one could see her true identity?

text: Ben bilirdim onda bir itlik olduğunu lakin bu kadarını da ummazdım.
english: I knew he had a dog, but I didn't expect that much.
Seeing the real face of my father's killer...

text: ...onun o pis suratına tükürmek hakkımızdır gayrı.
english: ...we have no right to spit on his dirty face.
It's Mr. Ertuğrul who's got him.

text: O kefereye vereceği ceza da, keseceği hüküm de...
english: And the punishment he will inflict on that scoundrel, and the sentence he will cut off.
Take him to the thesis healing tent.

text: ...Ertuğrul Bey'im, Beybolat Bey'in, babasının katiliyle yüzleşmesine...
english: ...that my Lord Ertugrul, Beybolat, faced his father's murderer...
I knew it would come to my feet.

text: ...Ertuğrul Bey'im çok büyük bir hata yapar.
english: ...my Lord Ertugrul makes a very big mistake.

text: Hâlâ bu topraklara hâkim olacağına inanır.
english: He still believes he'll take over this land.
As long as Commander Dragos is alive...
I'll rub you to the bone.
My soldiers will not leave me to die.
...if he'd left you in my hands...

text: ...ne de senin gücün beni öldürmeye yetmez.
english: ...and your power is not enough to kill me.

text: Seni Ertuğrul Bey'in adaletinden ancak bir mucize kurtarır.
english: Only a miracle will save you from the justice of Lord Ertuğrul.

text: Tanrı'nın mucizesi tükenir mi sandın Beybolat Bey?
english: Did you think the miracle of God was over, Beybolat?
...the Albasty who wounded my sisters died.

text: Korkak askerlerin de korkuyla kaleye hapsoldu.
english: The cowardly soldiers were also confined to the castle in fear.
...that will be the last night, Dragos.
They know that the cloud is not dead.
I'll tell you that you're a Negro.

text: Son ana kadar bekle. Seni kurtaracağım.
english: Wait till the last minute, I'll save you.

text: Dragos keferesi! Bizans iti! Ölümün benim elimden olacak.
english: Dragos's cock, the Byzantine dog, I'll take your death.

text: Bırak onu, ne yaparsın? Daha onunla işimiz var.
english: Let him go, what are you gonna do?

text: Kusura kalmayasın Abdurrahman Alpbaşı. Bu iti görünce öfkeme hâkim olamadım.
english: I'm sorry, Abdurrahman Alpsh, I couldn't control my anger when I saw this dog.
I understand your pain, your anger.
When we get the haircut tomorrow...
I'll look at that fear in your eyes!

text: Ertuğrul Bey'in çizmelerine yapışıp af dileyişini...
english: He's got to stick to Mr. Ertuğrul's boots and apologize...
You're going to wait a long time.
We ran into him on the road.

text: Neden buraya getirdiniz? Söğüt'e gitseydiniz ya.
english: Why did you bring him here?
We found it closer to the village.
I don't know, he's a strange merchant.
I was wondering, look at that freak.

text: ...imdi içeride şifacılar vardır. Ben de çıktım.

english: Let them heal his wound comfortably.
I might be able to help the healers.

text: Beyimin kesin emridir. İçeri kimseyi alamam.
english: It's my master's orders, I can't take anyone in.

text: Garip bir tüccarı, ağabeyim kimden saklar?
english: A strange merchant, who will my brother hide from?
The commander is cutting the iron, Ilbilge Hatun.
You can talk to my master about this.
...they asked us to give this to you.

text: (Beybolat iç ses) "Akşam mahzende bekliyorum. Komutan Branas."
english: (Beyond the bell) "I'll be waiting in the cellar tonight, Commander Branas".

text: (Beybolat iç ses) İyi, ben de sana gelecektim zaten.
english: (Babolating) Well, I was coming to you.

text: Kellesini almak istediği mahkûma son yemeğini getirmiş.
english: The prisoner he wanted to buy his head off brought his last meal.

text: Yoksa beni konuşturmak için mi geldin buraya?
english: Or did you come here to talk me into it?
I got it in excess of what I'm getting from you, Dragos.
I finished the take thanks to you.
I got the gold because of you.
You and I are very much alike, Ertuğrul.

text: Ben davam için imparatora isyan ettim...
english: I rebelled against the emperor for the cause...
...you've been leading the Mongols in the cause.

text: Ama sanma ki kazanan sen olacaksın.
english: But don't think you're the winner.

text: En çok neye güvenirim bilir misin?
english: You know what I trust most?

text: Çünkü bir olduğunuzda nasıl kafamıza inen bir balyoza dönüşüyorsanız...
english: Because when you're one, you become a badass.
...you're going to dig each other's well and turn into monsters.

text: Emir Bahaddin'i, Alıncak'ı, hatta şu ahmak Beybolat'ı bile kullandım.
english: I used Emir Bahaddin, Al-Qin, even that stupid Beybolat.

text: Hepsi de bilerek ya da bilmeyerek...
english: All of them, knowingly or unknowingly...

text: ...soğuk Söğüt gecelerinde benim ocağıma odun taşıdılar.
english: ...they carried wood to my stove on cold nights.
It's clear where you've finally fallen.
You know where you're going, Dragos.

text: Benim davam, senin kazacağın mezara sığmaz Ertuğrul.
english: My case is that the grave you dig will not fit, Ertuğrul.

text: Senin en belalı düşmanın olduğumu bilerek, anlayarak öleceksin.
english: You'll die knowing that I'm your worst enemy.

text: Sen kuzu postunda çakal, insan suretinde yılan oldun.
english: You're a jackal in a lamb post, a human snake.

text: O düşmanlarım kadar merhameti hak etmezsin.
english: You don't deserve as much mercy as those enemies.
Then why did you come here?
I wanted you to know before I died.

text: Yarından tezi yok, kurmak istediğin şer düzenini ezip geçeceğim.
english: Tomorrow, without a thesis, I will crush the evil scheme you want to set up.
I'll blow the castle down on your soldiers.
You don't have the strength to do that.
The soldiers were afraid and took refuge in the castle.

text: Gayrı onlara nefes bile aldırmayacağım Dragos.
english: I'm not gonna let them breathe, Dragos.
Maybe it'll clean up the mess inside...

text: ...temiz bir ölümle sefil hayatına son verirsin.
english: ...and you end your miserable life with a clean death.

text: (Dragos iç ses) Ölürsem yalnız ölmeyeceğim Ertuğrul.
english: (Dragos whispers) If I die, I will not die alone, Ertugrul.

text: (Dragos iç ses) Bil ki yanımda seni de götüreceğim.
english: (Dragos whispers) I'll take you with me.
I don't like the way her mom is.

text: Çadırın içinde divane gibi dolanır durur.
english: He's been wandering around the tent like a couch.

text: Beyimizin sözünü dinlemediği için kendini suçlar.
english: He blames himself for not listening to our lord.

text: At izinin, it izine karıştığı bu uç topraklarda...
english: In these far-flung lands where horse tracks are mixed with dog tracks...
...the obedience to our master that sustains us.
An experienced climber like his grandmother...
Of course she thought about her son.
...she should have been a little patient.
...and what he's going through is not easy.
He was first stripped of his rank.

text: Hepsi üst üste gelince Bamsı'm nasıl sabra sığınsın?
english: How can you be patient with my Bamsisi, all over again?

text: Anam, hangi babanın yüreği dayanır bunlara?
english: Mother, what father's heart can stand these things?
...you think Mr. Ertugrul wanted him dead?
The gentleman who is the gentleman...
You don't think he's moving his arrows?

text: Estağfurullah anam, ben onu demek isteme--
english: I'm sorry, Mom, I don't mean that she--

text: Atın iyisi yolda, kişinin hası darda belli olur.
english: The horse is good on the road, the man is bad on the road.
The final decision on the mother...

text: Onun kestiği hükme razı olmaktan başka yapacak bir şey yoktur.
english: He has no choice but to accept what he decides.

text: ...şayet Ertuğrul Bey'imiz ağır bir hüküm verirse, Bamsı bunu taşıyamaz.
english: ...if our Lord Ertuğrul makes a severe sentence, Bamsı cannot bear it.
When our Lord Ertuğrul has reduced him from the rank of...

text: ...Bamsı kendini cezalandırmak için alpliğinden feragat etti.
english: ...the old lady gave up her alpine life to punish herself.

text: İmdi kendini daha da ağır cezalandırır anam.
english: Now she punishes herself even more, Mom.
Mom can't live in this village.
And he told us to keep our tent...
...it's not a caravan that moves when it gets here.
You'll be punished, you'll be in trouble again.

text: ...göç diye bir şeye kalkışırsanız, gönülden düşersiniz.
english: ...if you try something like immigration, you'll be disappointed.

text: Gönül defterinden silinen bir daha asla yazılmaz.
english: The deleted from the heart's book will never be written again.
That's very nice of you, son.
He held himself responsible for what happened.

text: Bey otağı, yakınlarımız için iltimas istenecek...
english: Mr. Room, we're going to ask for a favor for our loved ones...

text: Yakınlarımız da olsa, beylik işlerinde gevşeklik gösterenlere verilecek af...
english: Even if we are close, pardon will be granted to those who show a lax temper in their gentlemanly deeds.
...is an evil done to the whole family.

text: Bamsı da hatasının bedeli neyse ödeyecektir.
english: And the old lady will pay the price for her mistake.
Have you heard what happened, Beybolat?

text: Bil ki Komutan Dragos'la yapmış olduğun anlaşmaya sadık kalacağız.
english: I want you to know that we will be faithful to your agreement with Commander Dragos.

text: Ertuğrul yarın Söğüt'te Dragos'u infaz edecek.
english: Ertugrul will execute Dragos in the Sultans tomorrow.

text: Ne öğrenmek istediğini ikimiz de biliriz.
english: We both know what you want to know.
Of course, if we can save him.
It's not just for the Dragos...
...and we'll do it to finish Ertugrul.
...and you get revenge on your father's killer.

text: Ertuğrul'un da sonunu zaten iş birliği edersek getirebiliriz.
english: And we can bring an end to Ertuğrul if we work together.

text: Sen de istediğin uç beyliğini alırsın.
english: You get the end brains you want.

text: Komutan Dragos'un hayatı bizim için her şeyden önemli.
english: Commander Dragos' life is more important to us than anything.

text: Biz her şeyi yapmaya hazırız Beybolat Bey.
english: We are ready to do anything, Beybolat.

text: Mademki cenk etmeye bu kadar heveslisiniz...
english: Since you're so eager to fight...
I'll tell you what to do.
You're gonna have to trust me and...
If you attack the command as a soldier...
We kill him, we take Commander Dragos.
When the execution is scheduled, it's daylight.
...and we have to finish it in the middle of the night.
That's the only way we can save Dragos.

text: Ertuğrul, Dragos gibi biri elindeyken her türlü tedbiri almıştır.
english: Ertuğrul took every precaution when he had someone like Dragos.

text: Kendinizi belli etmeden sızmanız gerek Söğüt'e.
english: You must infiltrate the Sultans without revealing yourself.

text: Siz tüccar ve ahali kılığında infazı seyretmek için sızarsanız...
english: If you sneak in to watch the execution in the guise of a merchant and a nobleman...
...and we'll hit him with a blow he didn't expect.

text: Ben de Alplerimle birlikte babamın katilinin infazını izlemeye gideceğim.
english: I'm going to go with my Alps and watch my father's killer be executed.
When the Dragos are brought in...
...while they fight you against this unexpected attack...
I'll shoot them in the back.
...and the Alps will not be free of us.

text: Dragos'u idama getirmeden evvel Alpler etrafa yerleşmiş olsun.
english: Have the Alps settle around before Dragos is executed.
All the Alps will be inhabited.

text: Muhtemel ki Dragos'un adamları da içeri tüccar kılığında sızacaktır.
english: Dragos' men will probably sneak in in the merchant's uniform.

text: Şafaktan itibaren Söğüt'e giren tüm tüccarlar takibe alınsın.
english: Every merchant who enters the Sughut shall be pursued from dawn.
Keep your eye on them, Abdurrahman.

text: Söğüt'ün iki girişi haricinde kaçabilecekleri ücra yerlere de...
english: And to the remote places they can escape, except for the two entrances to the cave.
...we're going to put the Alps in the population, sir.
Then there's nowhere left to run.

text: En mühimi de idam yerinde ahaliden kadın ve çocuğun olmamasıdır.
english: The most important thing is that there are no women and children on the scene.

text: Orada vuruşma çıkacağını bile bile ahaliyi tehlikeye atamayız.
english: We can't put our people at risk, even if we know there's going to be a fight.

text: Alpler tek tek evleri dolaşıp, herkese o gün dışarı çıkmamalarını söylesin.
english: Alps go around every house and tell everyone not to go out that day.

text: O gün kimse evinden çıkmayacak Abdurrahman.
english: No one will leave his house that day, Abdurrahman.
As you stretch out your hands to the Sultans...

text: Alpler şafakta kaleye giden bütün yollara pusulansınlar.
english: Let the Alps compass all the way to the castle at dawn.

text: Kaleden çıkanların bir daha kaleye dönüşü olmayacak.
english: Those who leave the castle will never return to the castle.
...we will finish the castle that falls to our throat, by pressing our fists.

text: Ya Bamsı'nın ahvali ne olacak beyim?
Ettiği hatanın o da farkındadır beyim.
english: He knows he's wrong, too, sir.
He knows how to bring grief, Bamshi.
If there's a mistake in the middle...
Call the Bamshi, let him come Abdurrahman.
What are we gonna do now, sir?
Are we going to leave Dragos in the hands of Ertuğrul?
The Ertigrul will not make him live.

text: Zaten konuşsa da, konuşmasa da ölecek.
english: He'll die, whether he talks or not.
We have to save Dragos, Baturalp.

text: Eğer ölmeden önce bizi ifşa ederse...
english: If he exposes us before he dies...

text: ...işte o vakit bizi bu topraklardan silerler.
english: ...then they will wipe us out of this land.
This is the end of us.
It's better if it's just the two of us.

text: Umuroğulları obasında taş üstünde taş, omuz üstünde baş bırakmazlar.
english: The Umuro's don't leave a stone on a stone, a head on a shoulder.
Ertuğrul's anger is sweeping the whole village.
It's impossible to get him out of the trenches, sir.
The whole thing is not gonna stop us.

text: Dragos'u kurtarırken Ertuğrul'un da işini bitireceğiz.
english: We'll finish up Ertugrul's job while we save Dragos.
(Sighs) Do you have a record, brother?

text: Çok şükür babamızın katili yakalanmış ağabey.
english: Thank God our father's killer got caught, brother.

text: Onun o ibretlik sonunu kendi ellerimle getirmek isterim.
english: I'd like to bring that sign to an end with my own hands.

text: Hele sakin olasın benim görklü bacım. Her bir şeyin vakti vardır.
english: Take it easy, my noble sister, there is a time for everything.
What's going on in the mansion, bro?

text: Daha evvel hiç görmediğim yaralı insanlar gelip gider.
english: I've never seen wounded people come and go.

text: Adı üstünde İlbilge, yaralıdır. Şifasını bulur, gider.
english: The man named Ilbilge is wounded, he's healed, he's gone.

text: Şifa çadırına girmek istedim, Baturalp müsaade etme.
english: I wanted to go into the healing tent, don't let Baturalp.

text: Ne vakittir benim buyruğum bana sorulur oldu?
Buyruğunu değil, şifa çadırındaki adamı sorarım.
english: I'm not asking your orders, I'm asking the man in the healing tent.
I wish I knew who he was, what he was like.
Don't get involved in the business of gentlemen with your poor mind.

text: Baturalp sana izah etmiş. Daha ne üstelersin?
Ne vakit sana soru sorsam geçiştirirsin.
english: Whenever I ask you a question, you pass.

text: Beylik töresinde oba hatunlarından gizli iş çevirmek var mıdır?
english: Is there a secret job for the wedding party from the village girl?
You're gonna cut me some slack?

text: İzah ederim, hâlâ ötesini berisini sorarsın.
english: I'll admit, you still ask me how much more.

text: Bu obada töre benim ağzımdan çıkandır!
english: I'm the one who's got the bullshit in this village!
It's not the dry-ass shit you did!

text: İmdi ayağımın altına almadan tez yıkıl. Hadi!
english: Now, get down there and wash off before I take you under my feet.

text: Ablam bazı şeyleri yavaş yavaş anlamaya başlamıştır ağabey.
english: My sister's starting to understand things slowly, brother.

text: O bir işin peşine düştü mü bırakmaz, bilirsin.
english: He's always been in business, you know.

text: Üstelik adalet, iki obanın birliği diye tutturdu mu…
english: And did justice make it a union of two families...
You know you're gonna betray me.
If he brings his doubts to Ertuğrul Bey...
Don't take the old man out of your sight, Serma.
Let's not get caught up in the game.
I told you, disobedience is unforgivable...

text: …aklını başına devşirmen gerekirken hata üstüne hata ekledin Bamsı.
english: ...you've added error to error when you have to brainstorm your mind, Bams.
Are you going to be stubborn with me?

text: Sana inat benim ne haddimedir beyim!
english: I'm so stubborn with you, sir!

text: Lakin bunu da oğlum için yapmışımdır.
english: But I did this for my son.
Well, you'd think about your son.

text: …biz senin oğlunu onların eline mi bırakacaktık?
english: ...we were going to leave your son in their hands?

text: Sana neyin ne olduğunu izah etmedim mi ben Bamsı?
english: Didn't I tell you what it was, Bamsy?
Didn't I give you an example of my own son?

text: Bu işin içinde oyun var dedim, demedim mi?
english: Didn't I say there was a game in this?
I sent Turgut to follow him...

text: …onları da atlatıp yine kendi bildiğini ettin!
english: ...you've got them overrun and done what you know!
You've been way out of line, Bams.
I thought the collar was dead.

text: Alıncak soysuzunu o yüzden aldım beyim.
english: That's why I bought the unleavened bread, sir.
Anger does not cover his misdeeds.

text: Sen nasıl benim elimdeki adamı alıp da Dragos’a götürürsün?
english: How can you take the man I have and take him to Dragos?

text: Yahu sen onun için nasıl pazarlık edersin?
english: Well, how do you negotiate for him?

text: …sen ne desen haklısın beyim. Ne desen haklısın.
Senin bana vereceğin her türlü cezaya ben razıyım beyim.
english: I'm all for whatever punishment you're gonna give me, sir.

text: Beni sen anlamayacaksın da kim anlayacak beyim.
english: You won't understand me, and I'm not a master.
That's why we lost the Albasty.

text: Sen kaç şehidimiz var, bilir misin?
english: Do you know how many martyrs we have?
I can't live with this shame, sir.
I can't look either of you in the face, sir.
I can't stay in this village.
I'm gonna pack my tent and get out of here.

text: Yine mi başına buyrukluk edeceksin Bamsı?
english: Are you gonna give orders to yourself again, Bams?
You gonna read what you know again?

text: Eğer benim buyruğum dışında bir şey yaparsan…
english: If you do anything outside my command...
I don't look at your age, Bams, you know.

text: Kendi vicdanın sana vereceği dersi versin…

english: ...and then I will tell you my verdict.

text: Şüphelendiğin bir şey oldu mu? İyi düşünesin hele.
(İlbilge dış ses) Yüzünde belli yara izi. Kaşının üstünde kılıç yarığı gibiydi.
english: (Screaming) There was a distinct scar on his face, like a sword crack on his eyebrows.

text: (İlbilge dış ses) Beni yaralamaktan imtina eder gibiydi.
english: (Shouting out loud) It was like he refused to hurt me.

text: (İlbilge dış ses) Ben vurulunca da kaçtı.
english: (Shouting out loud) And when I was shot, he ran away.

text: (Ertuğrul dış ses) Görsen tanır mısın İlbilge Hatun?
english: (Shouting out loud) Do you recognize the Elderly?

text: Sen de aklına bir şey gelirse bize haber edesin.
english: You let us know if you think of anything.
You're in the woods again, ma'am.

text: İçini bunaltan bir şey mi vardır?

english: I think about the man in the healing tent.

text: Selcan Hatun’la girdiğimiz vuruşmadaki adamlardan biri oydu.
english: He was one of the men in the fight we got into with Selcan Hatun.
The ones who took the blame.

text: Madem kaçındılar, neden seni vurdular hanımım?
english: If they escaped, why did they shoot you, ma'am?
They shot me in the back from a long distance.
And when they knew it was me, they ran away.

text: O adamın ağabeyimle bir alakası vardır.
english: That guy has something to do with my brother.
I've been looking at my brother for a long time.

text: Geceleri çıkar, yaralı gelir. Alpler de öyle.
english: He goes out at night, he gets hurt, so do the Alps.

text: İmdi de bu adam çıktı geldi.
Bu işin içinde bir iş vardır.
Ertuğrul Bey’e de bu adamdan bahsettim. O da kuşkulandı.
english: I told Ertuğrul Bey about this man, and he was suspicious.

text: Bir daha görürsen haber et dedi.
english: He said if you see him again, let me know.

text: Velev ki ettim, ne olur bilir misin?
İki oba arasında kan dökülür, Mengü.
english: Blood is spilled between the two villages, Mengyu.

text: O itin peşine düşüp, vakti gelince gırtlağına çökeceğim.
english: I'll chase that dog and I'll hit him in the throat when it's time.
Come on, sister, come on, you know what?

text: Altı üstü yaralı adamı sordum. Payladı beni.
english: I asked the man who was wounded six times, and he shared me.

text: Sen de neden böyle şeyleri kurcalarsın ki?

english: The man was injured, brought to the village.

text: Ağabeyim zaten burnundan solur, sen de ısrar edince sana patladı.
english: My brother's already blowing his nose, and when you insisted, it blew up.

text: Hem sen neden bu kadar üzerine düşersin?
english: And why are you falling so hard on her?

text: Burası yol geçen hanı mıdır? Adam umurumda bile değil.
Bizim şifa çadırımızda ne işi var, merak ettim.
english: I wondered what he was doing in our healing tent.

text: Hem bu kadar sinirleneceğini bilsem sorar mıyım hiç?
english: And if I knew you'd be so upset, would I ask?

text: Ağabeyimi bilirsin. Kıvılcımdan ateş alır, aleve dönüştürür.
english: You know my brother, he takes fire from my spark, turns it into flame.

text: Sen dert etmeyesin, sabaha siniri kalmaz.
english: Don't worry, I'll get the morning off.

text: Gündüzün şerri gecenin hayrından evladır derler.
english: They say, "The worst of the day is the best of the night".
Let's go to bed and rest.
We'll talk again in the morning.
I can't sleep in my eyes.
When I close my eyes, I see my Lord Ertuğrul.
I'll never forget his words, his looks.

text: Geldiğinden beri kendini yedin bitirdin Bamsı’m.
english: You've been eating yourself since you got here.

text: Elbet Ertuğrul Bey’imiz seni anlayacaktır. Müsterih olasın.
english: Of course, our Lord Ertuğrul will understand you.

text: Nasıl bırakıp giderdin ki evladını öyle?
english: How could you leave your son?

text: Yok Hafsa’m, yok. Ben Ertuğrul Bey’imi dinlemedim.
english: No, I didn't listen to my brother.

text: ...hâlbuki o da Aybars’ımı benim kadar düşünürmüş. Bilemedim.
english: ...but he thought of my Ayer as I did.
How long are you gonna be doing this, Bamsim?

text: Ettiğin hataysa, hata zaten insana mahsustur.
english: If you make a mistake, it's already human.
He obeys my judgment, we will take our punishment.

text: Hem ben inanırım ki Ertuğrul Bey’imiz sana ceza vermeyecektir.
english: And I believe that our Lord Ertuğrul will not punish you.

text: O ceza vermese ne olur Hafsa’m, ben kendimi nasıl affedeceğim…
english: What if he doesn't punish me? How can I forgive myself...
How am I supposed to look at their faces?
You'll be tired of the wool, Osman.
I think about the Bams Alpin.

text: Nereye varacak bu işin sonu, bilmem.
english: I don't know where this is going to end.

text: Babamla can gardaşıydılar. Ama imdiki hâl…
english: My father and I were cousins, but as it turns out...

text: Babam bu meselenin daha evvel de törelik bir mesele olduğunu söyledi.
english: My dad said this was a matter of some kind before.
Disobedience is at the top of the list.
We're supposed to scream and shut up.
The tower of righteousness is the pillar of heaven.
If the circle breaks, it can't stand in the sky.

text: Töre bir su gibidir. Bütün ateşleri söndürür.
english: It's like a water circle, it's like a fire that extinguishes all the flames.

text: Töreyle cihana öyle bir kut kuşağı bağlanır ki…
english: A cotton belt is attached to the cake and the device so that...

text: Kurtla kuzu aynı yerden su içer.
english: The wolf and the lamb drink water from the same place.

Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey!
These are the words of your fathers.
You're not gonna read this for nothing.

text: De hele bakalım, nereden hâsıl oldu bunları okumak?
